feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 4:32PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LIGHT FREEZING RAIN POSSIBLE FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... A weak front could bring light freezing rain and trace ice accumulations as it moves across Kuskokwim Delta late Wednesday into Thursday. Precipitation chances will be around 30-50% during this time.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 4:24PM AKST until November 23 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO 1 AM AKST THURSDAY FROM DILLINGHAM AND NORTH... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Bristol Bay, from Dillingham north.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 4:24PM AKST until November 23 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 21 at 1:32PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM AKST WEDNESDAY. North Pole has a Stage 2 alert.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 22 at 1:49AM MST until November 24 at 4:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DIFFICULT TRAVEL CONDITIONS EXPECTED THURSDAY NIGHT... .Moderate to heavy snow will impact the northern Front Range foothills beginning Thanksgiving evening and continuing through Friday, with the heaviest snow occurring late Thursday evening and overnight. Travel impacts can be expected, including for the Highway 34 and 36 corridors east of Estes Park, and Highway 14 east of
entry.cap:areaDesc: Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 22 at 1:35AM MST until November 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Northerly wind gusting 20 to 30 mph. * WHERE...Natrona County. * WHEN...5 AM Thanksgiving through Friday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Natrona County Lower Elevations

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 22 at 1:35AM MST until November 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THURSDAY TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Upper Green River Basin. * WHEN...From 8 AM Thursday to 11 AM MST Friday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 22 at 1:35AM MST until November 24 at 2:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THURSDAY TO 2 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 to 40 mph. * WHERE...South Lincoln County, Rock Springs and Green River, Flaming Gorge and East Sweetwater County.
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Sweetwater County; Flaming Gorge; Rock Springs and Green River; South Lincoln County

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 22 at 1:30AM MST until November 24 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH 11PM MST FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of panhandle Nebraska and east central and southeast Wyoming.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 22 at 1:30AM MST until November 24 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH 11 PM MST FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches possible. Isolated areas could see in excess of 14 inches in elevations above 8000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 22 at 1:30AM MST until November 24 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM MST THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH 11 PM MST FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 30-40 mph across areas of higher terrain along the Pine Ridge, and southeast Wyoming.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 22 at 1:15AM MST until November 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 16 inches possible. * WHERE...In Montana, Pryor/Northern Bighorn Mountains. In Wyoming, Northeast Bighorn Mountains.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 22 at 1:15AM MST until November 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 10 inches possible. * WHERE...In Montana, Bighorn Canyon and Southern Big Horn. In Wyoming, Sheridan Foothills.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued November 22 at 1:11AM MST until November 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...West winds 30 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County including Bordeaux. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST this morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 2:11PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Gusty Wind and Light Snow Thanksgiving Night... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Light snow occurring in conjunction with northeast wind 20 to 30 mph gusting around 40 mph. * WHERE...Sweetwater County, including communities along I-80 and
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Sweetwater County; Flaming Gorge; Rock Springs and Green River; Upper Green River Basin
